Key Match Events: Steph Curry scored 31 points on 22 shots, tying his season high with his eighth three-pointer.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. scored 18 points on 12 shots, punishing the Warriors’ smaller lineups and showing no fear against Draymond Green.
Nikola Jovic scored 20 points on 17 shots, including two crucial corner threes in the fourth quarter.
Miami Heat's zone defense effectively limited the Warriors, with the rest of Curry’s team shooting 6-of-33 from the arc.
Miami Heat's drive-and-kick action created numerous open three-point opportunities, finishing 6-of-13 from the corners.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr pulled his starters with three minutes to play as Miami led by 18 points, signaling the end of the game.
The Miami Heat ended their brief losing streak with a 114-98 victory over the Golden State Warriors.
